title: Creative Writing Prompts
description:
Writing Sideblog by agirlnamedjana; same on Wattpad.

Check out my Instagram for prompts and updates!

Find Prompt Fills from the community!

Please read my Blog Etiquette.

Masterpost: how to write|Master Prompt List

20 asks in inbox. 19 one word requests. Closed.

If you like what I do, you can buy me a coffee or become a member ?

Profile pic made with Djarn's character maker.
hashtags: ['anon ask', 'ask', 'how to write', 'how to write dual timelines', 'writing tips', 'writing advice', 'writing ideas', 'writing', 'writeblr']
writing_prompt:
asking_name': 'Anonymous', 'asking_url': None, 'question': '

Do you have any tips when it comes to writing a dual timeline?

For example: It\'s the apocalypse. The first chapter starts in the present. Apocalypse in full swing (like day 238 or smth) and then the next chapter jumps to Day 1 to slowly give a gimplse at what happened. Nad somewhere in the middle the timelines "meet" and its just one timeline

', 'answer': '

How to write dual timelines

Writing a story with dual timelines means that the story is being told from two different perspectives, each happening at another time. The POV can still come from the same person, but often the timelines are being told from the POV of someone else that has a connection to the other timeline and protagonist. The timelines can be only hours apart (often in crime stories) or hundreds of years apart.

When using your example of a few days apart, I would focus on the commonalities and also the differences that can be seen in just the span of a few weeks. How much has changed and what little things have stayed the same and why?

Both timelines need a reason for being used in the story. This structure needs to add depth to the plot and it can be used to reveal plot twists and overall enhance the narrative.

When talking about structure, the stories with dual timelines are often structured in a way that they jump back and forth between the timelines. You can start off by getting the readers invested in one timeline and then start switching it with the other timeline.

The problem with dual timelines can be that readers are more interested in one timeline then the other. So be careful to give both of them a good enough storyline and purpose for the whole story to be interesting and relevant for the reader.

So, the most important thing to remember is to find a good balance and to connect the timelines well enough that the flow seems seamless and it shows why both of the timelines are needed for the whole story to unfold.

Pro tip: Use some aspects (conflict, interests, worries, places, etc.) that are going on in both stories and when switching to the other timeline, carry whatever the first protagonist was doing or thinking over to the second protagonist.

- Jana
response: #not saying to read my fic but uhhhh #gone to hell is dual timeline and an apocalypse au #sounds exactly like what you‚Äôre looking for if you want to see how I‚Äôm doing it #apologies if that‚Äôs stepping on anyone‚Äôs toes #just thought I‚Äôd help

Writing a story with dual timelines means that the story is being told from two different perspectives, each happening at another time. The POV can still come from the same person, but often the timelines are being told from the POV of someone else that has a connection to the other timeline and protagonist. The timelines can be only hours apart (often in crime stories) or hundreds of years apart.

When using your example of a few days apart, I would focus on the commonalities and also the differences that can be seen in just the span of a few weeks. How much has changed and what little things have stayed the same and why?

Both timelines need a reason for being used in the story. This structure needs to add depth to the plot and it can be used to reveal plot twists and overall enhance the narrative.

When talking about structure, the stories with dual timelines are often structured in a way that they jump back and forth between the timelines. You can start off by getting the readers invested in one timeline and then start switching it with the other timeline.

The problem with dual timelines can be that readers are more interested in one timeline then the other. So be careful to give both of them a good enough storyline and purpose for the whole story to be interesting and relevant for the reader.

So, the most important thing to remember is to find a good balance and to connect the timelines well enough that the flow seems seamless and it shows why both of the timelines are needed for the whole story to unfold.

Pro tip: Use some aspects (conflict, interests, worries, places, etc.) that are going on in both stories and when switching to the other timeline, carry whatever the first protagonist was doing or thinking over to the second protagonist.

- Jana

The POV can still come from the same person, but often the timelines are being told from the POV of someone else that has a connection to the other timeline and protagonist. The timelines can be only hours apart (often in crime stories) or hundreds of years apart.

When using your example of a few days apart, I would focus on the commonalities and also the differences that can be seen in just the span of a few weeks. How much has changed and what little things have stayed the same and why?

Both timelines need a reason for being used in the story. This structure needs to add depth to the plot and it can be used to reveal plot twists and overall enhance the narrative.

When talking about structure, the stories with dual timelines are often structured in a way that they jump back and forth between the timelines. You can start off by getting the readers invested in one timeline and then start switching it with the other timeline.

The problem with dual timelines can be that readers are more interested in one timeline then the other. So be careful to give both of them a good enough storyline and purpose for the whole story to be interesting and relevant for the reader.

So, the most important thing to remember is to find a good balance and to connect the timelines well enough that the flow seems seamless and it shows why both of the timelines are needed for the whole story to unfold.

Pro tip: Use some aspects (conflict, interests, worries, places, etc.) that are going on in both stories and when switching to the other timeline, carry whatever the first protagonist was doing or thinking over to the second protagonist.

- Jana

title: Creative Writing Prompts
description:
Writing Sideblog by agirlnamedjana; same on Wattpad.

Check out my Instagram for prompts and updates!

Find Prompt Fills from the community!

Please read my Blog Etiquette.

Masterpost: how to write|Master Prompt List

20 asks in inbox. 19 one word requests. Closed.

If you like what I do, you can buy me a coffee or become a member ?

Profile pic made with Djarn's character maker.
writing_prompt:
Prompt #955

It may look pretty, but the crown made her head ache and she couldn‚Äôt wait to get back to her rooms to remove it.
response:
Lillie reflects how much the crown‚Äôs weight reflected her situation, weighed down by duties and obligations of Aether‚Äôs Crown Princess that she‚Äôs equally restricted by. 

Marry another male royal to continue the line. - Her betrothed‚Äôs loves her elder brother, and her heart belongs to the odd foreign boy, Sun, who washed up on Melemele in a storm.
Stay in the castle unless performing her duties. - Her mother‚Äôs wicked advisor runs the castle these days, and far worse there is a world outside that calls to her. A world that holds her brother, her friend, and her precious one. The walls of the castle feel more like a prison every day, and the crown a manacle keeping her there.
And most importantly: OBEY. - Obey Mother, obey Aether‚Äôs High Queen, even when it breaks her heart. Even if it hurts. Even when it hurts those she loves. Lillie must obey.
She sets the crown on her nightstand and looks at it with purest hate. This crown has taken everything from her, and it will keep taking from her forever. It‚Äôs stolen her freedom, her love, her light... Wouldn‚Äôt it be better if it was destroyed? It‚Äôs pretty now, but wouldn‚Äôt it be better in a million shiny pieces?

Smash the crown! a voice that sounds deceptively like her brother‚Äôs whispers in her mind. Smash it and run away to be free!
 And Lillie wants to. She wants so very badly to smash the accursed hunk of metal and flee Aether‚Äôs shores, never to look back. Find Sun, and flee to another region across the sea. Perhaps find the boy‚Äôs forgotten homeland, and live out their lives there. Sun‚Äôs skill in battle can‚Äôt be disputed, it wouldn‚Äôt be hard to make a living in an arena.

If she was gone, Hau would no longer be expected to marry her, and under Melemele‚Äôs laws, he could wed her brother.

Lillie lifts up her crown, and she almost, almost, smashes it into the wall. Almost decides to leave and reclaim her freedom, her love, and her light. But... But she remembers her last night with Sun. When, at Mother‚Äôs insistence, she told the young man that their time together had meant nothing, and that it was merely a moment‚Äôs entertainment for a princess to briefly lower herself to consort with a commoner.

She remember his beautiful brown eyes, so full of pain, as he demanded to know what he‚Äôd done wrong. As he‚Äôd called after as she‚Äôd walked away, refusing to turn around lest he see her tears, begging her to come back. Lillie hurt him so terribly that night, and she knows she can never take it back. She can‚Äôt go reclaim him, because he stopped being hers in that instant.

And so with a heart so much heavier than the crown could ever be, she reaches for the accursed adornment and places it back atop her head. It is what she deserves, and it is what she is. A cold, hurtful thing. Aether‚Äôs Crown Princess. #pokemon #lightsunshipping #sunflowershipping #lillie #sun

writing_prompt:
Prompt #955

It may look pretty, but the crown made her head ache and she couldn‚Äôt wait to get back to her rooms to remove it.
response:
Alexandra knew it wasn't the physical weight of it that bothered her, it was the pesky emotional weight that came with it. It was hardly heavy when compared to the iron helmet of her armor but every moment the crown was on her head was a moment that she couldn't forget how she had got it. The power had felt exhilarating then, and she wouldn't give it up now, but with each passing day, it also became harder to cling to as a source of comfort. The last words of the king she had beheaded echoed in her mind, refusing to be silenced."Those who snatch power are doomed to have it snatched away from them."
#writing prompts #my writing #wip: untitled warrior queen fic #ch: alexandra #my wips

writing_prompt:
Fun AU Combos II

I took my list of AUs and used a random number generator to create 10 AU combos, which may or may not seem crazy. Let’s see if they spark some ideas!

  1. Ghost AU x Boarding School AU
  2. Neighbors AU x Flower Shop AU
  3. Band AU x Historical AU
  4. Fairytale AU x Outer Space AU
  5. College AU x Boarding School AU
  6. Roommates AU x Tattoo Shop AU
  7. Supernatural/Magic AU x Firefighter AU
  8. Bookstore AU x Rockstar AU
  9. Superhero/Villain AU x Band AU
  10. Soulmates AU x Flower Shop AU

Number 3 calls for a bard, methinks. What do you think?

', 'reblog': {'comment': '

writing_prompt:
Prompt #952

‚ÄúWhen life gives you lemons, squirt the juice into your enemies‚Äô eyes and watch them whimper.‚Äù
response:
"Hey, what the fuck? Where the hell are you even getting those?"

My nemesis, that Clara, always asked too many questions.

"When life gives you lemons, I guess..."

When I woke up, there was a lemon in my hand.

While utterly confused, I simply added it to my fruit bowl, while privately wondering to myself if I had had bought that lemon yesterday. 

After I had dressed, I felt an odd lump in my pocket. 

Another lemon.

I took it out.

Another lemon?
At this point, I had to do something with my newfound (as of now) unlimited citrus. 

And so, I visited Clara. 

Clara was the leader of the gang of girls who had bullied me mercilessly when I was in middle school, all the way up to my senior year. 

And I knew where she lived.

Knock, knock.
"Hello? Oh, it's you." Her eyes, friendly when opening the door, quickly switched to a glare, her smile to a sneer.

"It's nice to see you too, Clara! Hasn't it been a while?" 

I didn't wait for a response, pointing a knife I had with me directly at her throat. 

"You do what I say, or you know what happens. Now be quiet, and get in the house."

While she yelped as soon as the blade grazed her throat, she followed.

"Sit."

I was irritated to see how well-off my former tormenter was doing.

I sat opposite Clara, eyeing her carefully.

"Make one move-"

She nodded. 

I took out the lemon from my pocket.

Still watching Clara, I sliced it open. 

Another lemon.

Sliced.

Repeat.

The ever-growing pile of lemons evidently frightened Clara.

After a while, the pile was large enough.

"Clara."

She looked at me, terrified of what was coming.

"Do you know the extent of the damage you did to me?"

"I'm so-"

"You aren't."

I picked up a lemon half and squirted the juice into her eyes.

Clara screamed in agony.

"Do you know how many times I screamed like that because of what you and your gang did?"

"I'M SORRY! I-"

Another half.

"AAAAAAAGHHHHH-"

"Do you remember?"

I stood over her now, watching the figure of the girl who had so tormented me then cower in pain.

"IT WAS YEARS AGO, YOU BITCH-"

Another half.

"I will make you regret those years. I will remind you of every little thing you did to me, so every memory is seared into your brain, as it is mine."
Perhaps, when this was over, if I didn't get into prison, I could make a living from these lemons.

Hm, or I could corrode the prison bars.

Either way, tonight was going to be fun.

#astralunarwrites #first story! #made sure to find something silly #just wanted to get something done #and hey i did it

hashtags: ['anon ask', 'ask', 'creative writing', 'prompt list', 'writing prompts', 'misunderstandings', 'writing inspiration', 'writing inspo', 'writing ideas', 'creativepromptsforwritingask', 'creativepromptsforwriting']
writing_prompt:
'asking_name': 'Anonymous', 'asking_url': None, 'question': '

Hello! Do you have prompts for misunderstandings between a couple, but then resolving?

', 'answer': '

Hi :)

Sure, here are some prompts for you:

Misunderstandings Prompts

  • Character A knows that their partner, Character B, has a big project coming up and therefore working overtime. And because they know that, they can’t believe their eyes when they see their partner in the mall they are at with their friends. - Gets resolved by their friends confronting Character B and finding out that they were looking for a ring.
  • They are finally on a date and Character A tries too act cool, and it’s too convincing and now Character B doesn’t think they are really into them. Character A needs to show that they are not really cool, but actually super excited.
  • Character A wants to throw an amazing surprise party for their partner, Character B. They try to work everything out behind their partner’s back and ask a party planner, Character C, for their help. Acquaintances see A and C together and tell B that their partner is likely having an affair.
  • Character A is pining after their best friend and is starting to feel guilty for how much they enjoy their friend’s easy touches and affections knowing that they themself want more than friendship. Unbeknownst to them, Character B actually thinks they’ve been in a relationship for a long time and Character A is just not ready yet for deeper intimacy.

Hope you like them!

- Jana
response: THE LAST ONE IS FUNNY OMG

hashtags: ['anon ask', 'ask', 'creative writing', 'prompt list', 'writing prompts', 'misunderstandings', 'writing inspiration', 'writing inspo', 'writing ideas', 'creativepromptsforwritingask', 'creativepromptsforwriting']
writing_prompt:
'asking_name': 'Anonymous', 'asking_url': None, 'question': '

Hello! Do you have prompts for misunderstandings between a couple, but then resolving?

', 'answer': '

Hi :)

Sure, here are some prompts for you:

Misunderstandings Prompts

  • Character A knows that their partner, Character B, has a big project coming up and therefore working overtime. And because they know that, they can’t believe their eyes when they see their partner in the mall they are at with their friends. - Gets resolved by their friends confronting Character B and finding out that they were looking for a ring.
  • They are finally on a date and Character A tries too act cool, and it’s too convincing and now Character B doesn’t think they are really into them. Character A needs to show that they are not really cool, but actually super excited.
  • Character A wants to throw an amazing surprise party for their partner, Character B. They try to work everything out behind their partner’s back and ask a party planner, Character C, for their help. Acquaintances see A and C together and tell B that their partner is likely having an affair.
  • Character A is pining after their best friend and is starting to feel guilty for how much they enjoy their friend’s easy touches and affections knowing that they themself want more than friendship. Unbeknownst to them, Character B actually thinks they’ve been in a relationship for a long time and Character A is just not ready yet for deeper intimacy.

Hope you like them!

- Jana

  • They are finally on a date and Character A tries too act cool, and it’s too convincing and now Character B doesn’t think they are really into them. Character A needs to show that they are not really cool, but actually super excited.
  • Character A wants to throw an amazing surprise party for their partner, Character B. They try to work everything out behind their partner’s back and ask a party planner, Character C, for their help. Acquaintances see A and C together and tell B that their partner is likely having an affair.
  • Character A is pining after their best friend and is starting to feel guilty for how much they enjoy their friend’s easy touches and affections knowing that they themself want more than friendship. Unbeknownst to them, Character B actually thinks they’ve been in a relationship for a long time and Character A is just not ready yet for deeper intimacy.

Hope you like them!

- Jana
response: #definitely not saving this for icemav purposes

response:
Fourth scenario character A here.

How exactly is this supposed to not fluster me?

#Elemental force #entities predating mortal notion of time #directly stating the plot #boundary breaking #getting written into the story #serious fiction dangers #no like seriously # you literally are inviting Tumblr to pull me into your realm using narration magic #do you have any idea how perverse this will get as they slowly begin to realize it's happening to a real person? #fairy prompt #difficulty breathing

writing_prompt:
'asking_name': 'Anonymous', 'asking_url': None, 'question': '

Do you have any tips on how to handle a polyamorous relationship where two of the people aren‚Äôt dating? Like A and B are dating, and B and C are dating, but A and C are just friends and both perfectly fine with the other one dating B.

', 'answer': '

I’m not the most knowledgable about this. I wrote OT3 Prompts before, but all of them were in a relationship with each other.

  • OT3 Prompts
  • OT3 Ideas

I have this post on How to write a polyamorous relationship in which I sum up things that I’ve heard about polyam relationships. But like I said in that post, it’s important to hear from people actually in that situation, so please consider asking people in relationships like that. I’m sure there are quite a few here on Tumblr.

- Jana
response: Hi anon. I dated like that, and I would say you could explore how each of the characters feels about the others, who came first and who came second, how they deal with minor jealousy (or how they dealt with major jealousy! Maybe not everyone was already aware of the poly stuff before this relationship came into life!), how B balances time with two partners. Best of luck <3

response: I'm not big on prompts but I could offer questions as food for thought. Do they live together, or are they in the same ish location and visit each other when they want, or does someone have to travel to see one of the others? Do they have common interests/do similar activities together, or is one of the partners for example more introverted and the other more extroverted? Are they all the same age or is one older/younger so that their childhood memories are different?

Do you have any tips on how to handle a polyamorous relationship where two of the people aren‚Äôt dating? Like A and B are dating, and B and C are dating, but A and C are just friends and both perfectly fine with the other one dating B.

', 'answer': '

response: Hey anon, what you are describing is a v type relationship and is actually the most common configuration for a polyam relationship. Person B is a hinge, there's actually a term for what person A and person C are to each other, they are metamores, often abbreviated as metas. If you're interested I have a whole section on polyamory linked on my master list.

hashtags: ['blind date prompts', 'blind dates', 'writing prompts', 'prompt list', 'writeblr', 'writing ideas', 'writing inspo', 'writing inspiration', 'writing community', 'writers on tumblr', 'creative writing']
writing_prompt:
Blind Date Prompts

  1. Character A heard Character B tell the waitress that they are nervous for their blind date, but no one shows up. So Character B sits down to act like the date.
  2. Character A gets pressured by their parents to go on a blind date. They don’t want to so they send their friend, Character C, to the date with Character B.
  3. Same scenario as no. 3, but Character B also send their friend, Character D, instead.
  4. Character A‚Äôs last one night stand ended with a misunderstanding and a lot of awkwardness. To cheer them up again, their friends set them up with a blind date. They meant well, it‚Äôs not their fault that it‚Äôs the person they had previously slept with.
  5. It’s a social experiment to actually blind date with blind folds on. They can only hear each other’s voice and maybe hold hands.
  6. Character A and Character B go on a blind date and don’t hit it off immediately. But they already bought tickets to a concert they both wanted to attend, so they still go together. Maybe they just needed more time to get to know each other.
  7. A group of friends drunkenly make bets on NYE that they wouldn’t be single next year. Now all of Character A’s friends have partners and they have less than a month left to find someone. Cue a bunch of blind dates.
  8. It’s a a double blind date and they realize quickly that they actually want to swap their dates.
  9. Character A is not a kiss and tell kind of person, so their friends start to think that they have been alone for way too long now and set them up with Character B. What the friends don‚Äôt know is that they both already know each other ‚Äì intimately.
  10. Character A‚Äôs friends are obsessed with setting them up with blind dates, and A knows they mean well, but they are just not interested in dating, so they just ask their last blind date, Character B, to fake date them, so A‚Äôs friends stop setting them up.

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can\xa0buy me a coffee\xa0or\xa0become a member! And check out my\xa0Instagram! ??

  7. A group of friends drunkenly make bets on NYE that they wouldn’t be single next year. Now all of Character A’s friends have partners and they have less than a month left to find someone. Cue a bunch of blind dates.
  8. It’s a a double blind date and they realize quickly that they actually want to swap their dates.
  9. Character A is not a kiss and tell kind of person, so their friends start to think that they have been alone for way too long now and set them up with Character B. What the friends don‚Äôt know is that they both already know each other ‚Äì intimately.
  10. Character A‚Äôs friends are obsessed with setting them up with blind dates, and A knows they mean well, but they are just not interested in dating, so they just ask their last blind date, Character B, to fake date them, so A‚Äôs friends stop setting them up.

hashtags: ['first kisses', 'first kiss prompts', 'prompt list', 'writing', 'writeblr', 'writing prompts', 'soft kisses', 'soft prompts', 'fluffy', 'writers of tumblr', 'writing community']
writing_prompt:
First Kisses

The first kiss between two characters.

  • an accidental kiss
  • kissing as a dare
  • finally kissing, after a long time of pining
  • a surprise kiss, catching one of them off guard
  • learning how to kiss together
  • desperately kissing, being in danger
  • kissing as part of a game
  • movie kiss/kissing while acting
  • kissing in the heat of the moment
  • a soft and unsure kiss
  • kissing to prove a point
  • at first a gentle kiss, getting deeper and deeper
  • winning and a kiss as a reward
  • kissing to try it out
  • laughing while kissing
  • a breathless kiss
  • kissing as a distraction
  • a kiss on the corner of the mouth
  • smiling while softly kissing, finally showing their love

First Kiss Prompts | Kisses Masterpost

writing_prompt:
First Kisses

The first kiss between two characters.

  • an accidental kiss
  • kissing as a dare
  • finally kissing, after a long time of pining
  • a surprise kiss, catching one of them off guard
  • learning how to kiss together
  • desperately kissing, being in danger
  • kissing as part of a game
  • movie kiss/kissing while acting
  • kissing in the heat of the moment
  • a soft and unsure kiss
  • kissing to prove a point
  • at first a gentle kiss, getting deeper and deeper
  • winning and a kiss as a reward
  • kissing to try it out
  • laughing while kissing
  • a breathless kiss
  • kissing as a distraction
  • a kiss on the corner of the mouth
  • smiling while softly kissing, finally showing their love

First Kiss Prompts | Kisses Masterpost

response:
"I did indeed," Morty agreed, tightening the arm over the ginger's shoulders just a little more. "But you will thank me later."

"Will I, now?" Mirabell cocked a brow at the Englishman before frowning at his smile. "what?"

"Nothing, love."

"Nae, it's something."

"It's really not. Well, not much at least."

"Then what?"

"You're cute when your mad."

"Oh, aye?" Putting on an overly exaggerated smile, Mirabell batted her lashes at the curator and stood on tiptoes so she could whisper. "Then I should be downright gorgeous in a moment, because I am about to be beyond mad."

#SoS Mirabell McRae #SoS Morty Harper #My OCs #My writing #Not my prompt

writing_prompt:
'asking_name': 'Anonymous', 'asking_url': None, 'question': '

any prompt for blind faith?

', 'answer': '

Blind Faith Prompts

  • “I trusted you. There was a time when nothing could’ve convinced me that you could ever do something like this.”
  • She wasn’t exactly worried. Except that she was. She did have full trust in him, but the circumstances just were against them.
  • “I believe in you. I will always stand by your side.”
  • “Blind faith is not without its dangers.”
  • “There is so much that can go wrong. I don’t know if I can do it.” “But I know it. I know you can do it.”
  • “You should learn not to naively put your trust in other people without questioning their motive.”
  • “I can’t believe that you would just blindly trust anything they say.”

- Jana

', 'reblog': {'comment': '

writing_prompt:
'asking_name': 'Anonymous', 'asking_url': None, 'question': '

any prompt for blind faith?

', 'answer': '

Blind Faith Prompts

  • “I trusted you. There was a time when nothing could’ve convinced me that you could ever do something like this.”
  • She wasn’t exactly worried. Except that she was. She did have full trust in him, but the circumstances just were against them.
  • “I believe in you. I will always stand by your side.”
  • “Blind faith is not without its dangers.”
  • “There is so much that can go wrong. I don’t know if I can do it.” “But I know it. I know you can do it.”
  • “You should learn not to naively put your trust in other people without questioning their motive.”
  • “I can’t believe that you would just blindly trust anything they say.”

- Jana

writing_prompt:
'asking_name': 'Anonymous', 'asking_url': None, 'question': '

any prompt for blind faith?

', 'answer': '

Blind Faith Prompts

  • “I trusted you. There was a time when nothing could’ve convinced me that you could ever do something like this.”
  • She wasn’t exactly worried. Except that she was. She did have full trust in him, but the circumstances just were against them.
  • “I believe in you. I will always stand by your side.”
  • “Blind faith is not without its dangers.”
  • “There is so much that can go wrong. I don’t know if I can do it.” “But I know it. I know you can do it.”
  • “You should learn not to naively put your trust in other people without questioning their motive.”
  • “I can’t believe that you would just blindly trust anything they say.”

- Jana

writing_prompt:
'asking_name': 'Anonymous', 'asking_url': None, 'question': '

One Word Request:

Fever

', 'answer': '

Sickness Dialogue Prompts

Fever

  • It was like a fever dream that unfortunately became reality.
  • “We need to keep the fever down, so that we can move from here.”
  • “Your forehead is a bit warm, but nothing a little bit of rest can’t fix.”
  • “Do you have a fever? Or are you just casually seeing things now?”
  • “I’ll make you leg compresses. It’s what my mom always did when I had a fever as a kid.”
  • “This must be a fever dream. This can’t really be happening.”
  • “Do you feel hot? Are you dizzy?”
  • “You have a fever. We should go to a doctor before it gets worse.”
  • “It’s okay for now, but we don’t want it to get infected. If you’re feeling too warm, let me know.”

writing_prompt:
creativepromptsforwriting:

Smutty One-Liners Part IV

  1. “Can you feel how much I want you?”
  2. “I can never get enough of your taste.”
  3. “Let’s try something new tonight.”
  4. “We don’t even have to take our clothes off.”
  5. “I want to ruin you.”
  6. “Yes, please, do it!”
  7. “Your tongue is truly extraordinary.”
  8. “I have seen you naked before.”
  9. “No bed needed.”
  10. “Sleep is overrated. I have better ideas.”
  11. “You know me so well. You always find the right spot.”
  12. “Please, don’t ever stop!”
  13. “Our bodies fit so well together.”
  14. “I could do this all day. And definitely all night.”
  15. “Let’s get you out of those clothes.”

Part I\xa0|\xa0Part II\xa0|\xa0Part III

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can\xa0buy me a coffee! And check out my\xa0Instagram! ??

Writing Sideblog by agirlnamedjana; same on Wattpad.

Check out my Instagram for prompts and updates!

Find Prompt Fills from the community!

Please read my Blog Etiquette.

Masterpost: how to write|Master Prompt List

20 asks in inbox. 19 one word requests. Closed.

If you like what I do, you can buy me a coffee or become a member ?

Profile pic made with Djarn's character maker.
hashtags: ['creative writing', 'smut', 'smutty dialogue', 'prompt list', 'writing prompts', 'writing inspiration', 'writeblr', 'writing', 'writers of tumblr']
writing_prompt:
creativepromptsforwriting:

Smutty One-Liners Part IV

  1. “Can you feel how much I want you?”
  2. “I can never get enough of your taste.”
  3. “Let’s try something new tonight.”
  4. “We don’t even have to take our clothes off.”
  5. “I want to ruin you.”
  6. “Yes, please, do it!”
  7. “Your tongue is truly extraordinary.”
  8. “I have seen you naked before.”
  9. “No bed needed.”
  10. “Sleep is overrated. I have better ideas.”
  11. “You know me so well. You always find the right spot.”
  12. “Please, don’t ever stop!”
  13. “Our bodies fit so well together.”
  14. “I could do this all day. And definitely all night.”
  15. “Let’s get you out of those clothes.”

Part I\xa0|\xa0Part II\xa0|\xa0Part III

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can\xa0buy me a coffee! And check out my\xa0Instagram! ??

  2. “I can never get enough of your taste.”
  3. “Let’s try something new tonight.”
  4. “We don’t even have to take our clothes off.”
  5. “I want to ruin you.”
  6. “Yes, please, do it!”
  7. “Your tongue is truly extraordinary.”
  8. “I have seen you naked before.”
  9. “No bed needed.”
  10. “Sleep is overrated. I have better ideas.”
  11. “You know me so well. You always find the right spot.”
  12. “Please, don’t ever stop!”
  13. “Our bodies fit so well together.”
  14. “I could do this all day. And definitely all night.”
  15. “Let’s get you out of those clothes.”

Part I | Part II | Part III

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can buy me a coffee! And check out my Instagram! 🥰

Smutty One-Liners Part IV

  1. “Can you feel how much I want you?”
  2. “I can never get enough of your taste.”
  3. “Let’s try something new tonight.”
  4. “We don’t even have to take our clothes off.”
  5. “I want to ruin you.”
  6. “Yes, please, do it!”
  7. “Your tongue is truly extraordinary.”
  8. “I have seen you naked before.”
  9. “No bed needed.”
  10. “Sleep is overrated. I have better ideas.”
  11. “You know me so well. You always find the right spot.”
  12. “Please, don’t ever stop!”
  13. “Our bodies fit so well together.”
  14. “I could do this all day. And definitely all night.”
  15. “Let’s get you out of those clothes.”

Part I | Part II | Part III

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can buy me a coffee! And check out my Instagram! 🥰

hashtags: ['hurt comfort dialogue prompts', 'hurt comfort', 'writing inspiration', 'writing inspo', 'writing prompts', 'prompt list', 'writing ideas', 'creative writing', 'writeblr']
writing_prompt:
Hurt/Comfort Dialogue Prompts

Part III - Your promised gift from this poll!

  1. “Could you hold me? Please.”
  2. “Drink some of this tea, it will warm you up.”
  3. “I’ll do it for you, don’t think about it.”
  4. “Nothing I’ll say will make it go away, but maybe I can make it a bit better.”
  5. “Silly of you to think, you would have to do this alone.”
  6. “You can squeeze my hand if it gets too much.”
  7. “Do you want me to read to you?”
  8. “Put your head on my shoulder.”
  9. “Go to sleep, I will not leave you alone.”
  10. “I’m afraid I’m not the best nurse, but I’ll try.”
  11. “Show me your wounds.”
  12. “After a while it will be easier.”
  13. “Time for your medicine. Here you are.”
  14. “I will always watch over you.”
  15. “Maybe not pretty, but you’re alive.”
  16. “Remember that I promised to never let you go.”
  17. “I would like to hold onto you a while longer.”
  18. “You don’t have to say anything, I’ll do the talking.”
  19. “Come here, let me take a look at you.”
  20. “The hurt will stop eventually. I promise.”
  21. “Don’t look down. I’ve got you.”
  22. “Just listen to my breathing and try to match it.”
  23. “Is it okay to hold you this tightly?”
  24. “You can take my hand if you want to.”
  25. “Can you smile for me? Alright, that’s a good start.”

Part I | Part II

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can\xa0buy me a coffee\xa0or\xa0become a member! And check out my\xa0Instagram! ??!??

writing_prompt:
Hurt/Comfort Dialogue Prompts

Part III - Your promised gift from this poll!

  1. “Could you hold me? Please.”
  2. “Drink some of this tea, it will warm you up.”
  3. “I’ll do it for you, don’t think about it.”
  4. “Nothing I’ll say will make it go away, but maybe I can make it a bit better.”
  5. “Silly of you to think, you would have to do this alone.”
  6. “You can squeeze my hand if it gets too much.”
  7. “Do you want me to read to you?”
  8. “Put your head on my shoulder.”
  9. “Go to sleep, I will not leave you alone.”
  10. “I’m afraid I’m not the best nurse, but I’ll try.”
  11. “Show me your wounds.”
  12. “After a while it will be easier.”
  13. “Time for your medicine. Here you are.”
  14. “I will always watch over you.”
  15. “Maybe not pretty, but you’re alive.”
  16. “Remember that I promised to never let you go.”
  17. “I would like to hold onto you a while longer.”
  18. “You don’t have to say anything, I’ll do the talking.”
  19. “Come here, let me take a look at you.”
  20. “The hurt will stop eventually. I promise.”
  21. “Don’t look down. I’ve got you.”
  22. “Just listen to my breathing and try to match it.”
  23. “Is it okay to hold you this tightly?”
  24. “You can take my hand if you want to.”
  25. “Can you smile for me? Alright, that’s a good start.”

Part I | Part II

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can\xa0buy me a coffee\xa0or\xa0become a member! And check out my\xa0Instagram! ??!??

writing_prompt:
Hurt/Comfort Dialogue Prompts

Part III - Your promised gift from this poll!

  1. “Could you hold me? Please.”
  2. “Drink some of this tea, it will warm you up.”
  3. “I’ll do it for you, don’t think about it.”
  4. “Nothing I’ll say will make it go away, but maybe I can make it a bit better.”
  5. “Silly of you to think, you would have to do this alone.”
  6. “You can squeeze my hand if it gets too much.”
  7. “Do you want me to read to you?”
  8. “Put your head on my shoulder.”
  9. “Go to sleep, I will not leave you alone.”
  10. “I’m afraid I’m not the best nurse, but I’ll try.”
  11. “Show me your wounds.”
  12. “After a while it will be easier.”
  13. “Time for your medicine. Here you are.”
  14. “I will always watch over you.”
  15. “Maybe not pretty, but you’re alive.”
  16. “Remember that I promised to never let you go.”
  17. “I would like to hold onto you a while longer.”
  18. “You don’t have to say anything, I’ll do the talking.”
  19. “Come here, let me take a look at you.”
  20. “The hurt will stop eventually. I promise.”
  21. “Don’t look down. I’ve got you.”
  22. “Just listen to my breathing and try to match it.”
  23. “Is it okay to hold you this tightly?”
  24. “You can take my hand if you want to.”
  25. “Can you smile for me? Alright, that’s a good start.”

Part I | Part II

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can\xa0buy me a coffee\xa0or\xa0become a member! And check out my\xa0Instagram! ??!??

  3. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll do it for you, don‚Äôt think about it.‚Äù
  4. ‚ÄúNothing I‚Äôll say will make it go away, but maybe I can make it a bit better.‚Äù
  5. ‚ÄúSilly of you to think, you would have to do this alone.‚Äù
  6. ‚ÄúYou can squeeze my hand if it gets too much.‚Äù
  7. ‚ÄúDo you want me to read to you?‚Äù
  8. ‚ÄúPut your head on my shoulder.‚Äù
  9. ‚ÄúGo to sleep, I will not leave you alone.‚Äù
  10. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm afraid I‚Äôm not the best nurse, but I‚Äôll try.‚Äù
  11. ‚ÄúShow me your wounds.‚Äù
  12. ‚ÄúAfter a while it will be easier.‚Äù
  13. ‚ÄúTime for your medicine. Here you are.‚Äù
  14. ‚ÄúI will always watch over you.‚Äù
  15. ‚ÄúMaybe not pretty, but you‚Äôre alive.‚Äù
  16. ‚ÄúRemember that I promised to never let you go.‚Äù
  17. ‚ÄúI would like to hold onto you a while longer.‚Äù
  18. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to say anything, I‚Äôll do the talking.‚Äù
  19. ‚ÄúCome here, let me take a look at you.‚Äù
  20. ‚ÄúThe hurt will stop eventually. I promise.‚Äù
  21. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt look down. I‚Äôve got you.‚Äù
  22. ‚ÄúJust listen to my breathing and try to match it.‚Äù
  23. ‚ÄúIs it okay to hold you this tightly?‚Äù
  24. ‚ÄúYou can take my hand if you want to.‚Äù
  25. ‚ÄúCan you smile for me? Alright, that‚Äôs a good start.‚Äù

Part I | Part II

  2. ‚ÄúDrink some of this tea, it will warm you up.‚Äù
  3. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll do it for you, don‚Äôt think about it.‚Äù
  4. ‚ÄúNothing I‚Äôll say will make it go away, but maybe I can make it a bit better.‚Äù
  5. ‚ÄúSilly of you to think, you would have to do this alone.‚Äù
  6. ‚ÄúYou can squeeze my hand if it gets too much.‚Äù
  7. ‚ÄúDo you want me to read to you?‚Äù
  8. ‚ÄúPut your head on my shoulder.‚Äù
  9. ‚ÄúGo to sleep, I will not leave you alone.‚Äù
  10. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm afraid I‚Äôm not the best nurse, but I‚Äôll try.‚Äù
  11. ‚ÄúShow me your wounds.‚Äù
  12. ‚ÄúAfter a while it will be easier.‚Äù
  13. ‚ÄúTime for your medicine. Here you are.‚Äù
  14. ‚ÄúI will always watch over you.‚Äù
  15. ‚ÄúMaybe not pretty, but you‚Äôre alive.‚Äù
  16. ‚ÄúRemember that I promised to never let you go.‚Äù
  17. ‚ÄúI would like to hold onto you a while longer.‚Äù
  18. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to say anything, I‚Äôll do the talking.‚Äù
  19. ‚ÄúCome here, let me take a look at you.‚Äù
  20. ‚ÄúThe hurt will stop eventually. I promise.‚Äù
  21. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt look down. I‚Äôve got you.‚Äù
  22. ‚ÄúJust listen to my breathing and try to match it.‚Äù
  23. ‚ÄúIs it okay to hold you this tightly?‚Äù
  24. ‚ÄúYou can take my hand if you want to.‚Äù
  25. ‚ÄúCan you smile for me? Alright, that‚Äôs a good start.‚Äù

Part I | Part II

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can\xa0buy me a coffee\xa0or\xa0become a member! And check out my\xa0Instagram! ??!??

', 'content': '

Hurt/Comfort Dialogue Prompts

Part III - Your promised gift from this poll!

  1. “Could you hold me? Please.”
  2. “Drink some of this tea, it will warm you up.”
  3. “I’ll do it for you, don’t think about it.”
  4. “Nothing I’ll say will make it go away, but maybe I can make it a bit better.”
  5. “Silly of you to think, you would have to do this alone.”
  6. “You can squeeze my hand if it gets too much.”
  7. “Do you want me to read to you?”
  8. “Put your head on my shoulder.”
  9. “Go to sleep, I will not leave you alone.”
  10. “I’m afraid I’m not the best nurse, but I’ll try.”
  11. “Show me your wounds.”
  12. “After a while it will be easier.”
  13. “Time for your medicine. Here you are.”
  14. “I will always watch over you.”
  15. “Maybe not pretty, but you’re alive.”
  16. “Remember that I promised to never let you go.”
  17. “I would like to hold onto you a while longer.”
  18. “You don’t have to say anything, I’ll do the talking.”
  19. “Come here, let me take a look at you.”
  20. “The hurt will stop eventually. I promise.”
  21. “Don’t look down. I’ve got you.”
  22. “Just listen to my breathing and try to match it.”
  23. “Is it okay to hold you this tightly?”
  24. “You can take my hand if you want to.”
  25. “Can you smile for me? Alright, that’s a good start.”

Part I | Part II

If you like my blog and want to support me, you can buy me a coffee or become a member! And check out my Instagram! 🥰!🥰

writing_prompt:
Writing Prompt #2245

She cupped a hand around his face, trying to fake an earnest smile as the light began to dim from his eyes.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to fix this for you‚Äîit‚Äôs what all the late nights of practice have been for. You‚Äôre going to be alright, and we‚Äôll laugh about how stupid this all was later.‚Äù
response: ‚ÄúDaughter‚Ä¶‚Äù the failing prince murmured, breath coming in wheezing gasps. Blood stained the lavish covers. What a pity, she thought, that he‚Äôd waste his blood on such expensive cloth. ‚ÄúYou killed my brother,‚Äù Princess Collera growled. ‚ÄúDo you regret it?‚Äù ‚ÄúDaughter-‚Äú Prince Timore hissed, and after a brief bout of coughing, he began again. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt, dearie-‚Äú She pulled out her own sword - a fine steel blade that Forze had forged - and let it test the threads of the blankets. ‚ÄúHe was no threat.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy must you ask me now?‚Äù Timore said, voice a mere whisper. ‚ÄúWhy now?‚Äù ‚ÄúSir Coltello trained me,‚Äù she snarled, fingers tightening on the hilt of her sword. ‚ÄúWe are alone.‚Äù ‚ÄúDo you truly wish to commit regicide?‚Äù Timore murmured, trying to raise a hand to swat away the sword.  ‚ÄúIt is what you would have done,‚Äù she answered, eyes narrow and calculates. ‚ÄúWhat did Muto do to you?‚Äù ‚ÄúIt was inevitable, for me to gain the throne. You will understand one day, Collie.‚Äù Collera‚Äôs teeth grit together, and she rested her sword against Prince Timore the Shrewd‚Äôs delicate, pale neck. His blue eyes widened in shock, and his final words were, ‚ÄúYou wouldn‚Äôt dare.‚Äù ‚ÄúI would,‚Äù she purred, a casual smile on her lips. ‚ÄúLike you said. The strong must be brave, and the brave must be clever. And you, dear father, are neither brave nor clever. You are a coward. Good night.‚Äù Later, she will point fingers to a lowly maid. She will insist that she had gone to relieve herself, and she had found dear Molle holding her old father‚Äôs blade. She will polish her blade as Molle‚Äôs shrieks of fear ring from the hanging yard, and smile as her screams are cut short. Later, she will visit Timore‚Äôs grave, and rip up the headstone and shatter it over Muto‚Äôs gravestone. She will lay a bud of marigold on the path of earth and sob quietly. When another maid asks her what she is doing, she shall cry despair to her traitor father and let her state drive away the poor servant. But today, her sword cuts through flesh and blood and bone, and as her father gurgles and dies, she shall wish that she had not let him pass so quickly, so mercifully. He deserved to suffer.

Writing Prompt #2244

The princess sat at her father’s bedside, knowing this was likely the last time she would do so. She should have felt grief for losing him, but all she could feel was anger.
response: ‚ÄúDaughter‚Ä¶‚Äù the failing prince murmured, breath coming in wheezing gasps. Blood stained the lavish covers. What a pity, she thought, that he‚Äôd waste his blood on such expensive cloth. ‚ÄúYou killed my brother,‚Äù Princess Collera growled. ‚ÄúDo you regret it?‚Äù ‚ÄúDaughter-‚Äú Prince Timore hissed, and after a brief bout of coughing, he began again. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt, dearie-‚Äú She pulled out her own sword - a fine steel blade that Forze had forged - and let it test the threads of the blankets. ‚ÄúHe was no threat.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy must you ask me now?‚Äù Timore said, voice a mere whisper. ‚ÄúWhy now?‚Äù ‚ÄúSir Coltello trained me,‚Äù she snarled, fingers tightening on the hilt of her sword. ‚ÄúWe are alone.‚Äù ‚ÄúDo you truly wish to commit regicide?‚Äù Timore murmured, trying to raise a hand to swat away the sword.  ‚ÄúIt is what you would have done,‚Äù she answered, eyes narrow and calculates. ‚ÄúWhat did Muto do to you?‚Äù ‚ÄúIt was inevitable, for me to gain the throne. You will understand one day, Collie.‚Äù Collera‚Äôs teeth grit together, and she rested her sword against Prince Timore the Shrewd‚Äôs delicate, pale neck. His blue eyes widened in shock, and his final words were, ‚ÄúYou wouldn‚Äôt dare.‚Äù ‚ÄúI would,‚Äù she purred, a casual smile on her lips. ‚ÄúLike you said. The strong must be brave, and the brave must be clever. And you, dear father, are neither brave nor clever. You are a coward. Good night.‚Äù Later, she will point fingers to a lowly maid. She will insist that she had gone to relieve herself, and she had found dear Molle holding her old father‚Äôs blade. She will polish her blade as Molle‚Äôs shrieks of fear ring from the hanging yard, and smile as her screams are cut short. Later, she will visit Timore‚Äôs grave, and rip up the headstone and shatter it over Muto‚Äôs gravestone. She will lay a bud of marigold on the path of earth and sob quietly. When another maid asks her what she is doing, she shall cry despair to her traitor father and let her state drive away the poor servant. But today, her sword cuts through flesh and blood and bone, and as her father gurgles and dies, she shall wish that she had not let him pass so quickly, so mercifully. He deserved to suffer.

Writing Prompt #2243

He loved her more than anything, and always vowed to do whatever he could to protect her.

No matter the cost to him.
response: He loved her more than anything, and always vowed to do whatever he could to protect her. No matter the cost to him. And that is why Jazz can't tell him what those cultist creeps said. That Josh ‚Äì her Josh ‚Äì only exists to kill her. To stop her ascension, her "apotheosis" whatever that means. It can't be true Josh ‚Äì wildviciousmonstrouslobo ‚Äì would never hurt her. For all the madness and rage he turns loose in the other world, he's never once laid an unwelcome finger on her or anyone else that wasn't threatening her or their friends. But if he found out about this... prophecy... proclaiming it's his destiny to try and kill her, it could very well break him. She knows he never would, but he's been slightly afraid of himself ever since Fenrir tore himself loose of his soul. To learn he's meant to kill her might tarnish the faith in himself he's finally managed to build. She can't bear losing him. Not to cultists ‚Äì joshsbodyisbrokentheresbloodtheressomuchblood ‚Äì or to the emptiness and self loathing the disgusting woman from the church left behind when she tore away his innocence ‚Äì she knows that her love occasionally feels like a real monster, unlovable and unclean ‚Äì because she loves him just as deeply. So she can't tell him. Ever. She can't let him break. #promptsforthestrugglingauthor # Jazz and Josh

Writing Prompt #2243

He loved her more than anything, and always vowed to do whatever he could to protect her.

No matter the cost to him.
response: He loved her more than anything, and always vowed to do whatever he could to protect her.  She couldn‚Äôt understand the ways he went hot and cold with her. It frustrated her even as she smiled and wanted to make the most of their time together. Eventually though, she would crack, and all of the confusing feelings would come spilling out, rapid fire, one after another, faster than he could respond or even begin to calm her down. Maybe she didn‚Äôt need to be calm - maybe he needed to be honest. But could he possibly explain the way he felt? The things she brought out of him that scared him. The feelings he never believed could be real; feelings that, even as he felt them, he feared were simply a prelude to agony, if things didn‚Äôt work out‚Ä¶ The way he was afraid of letting her down, or hurting any part of her. The ways he was afraid that he wasn‚Äôt enough for her, even as he reassured her she wasn‚Äôt too much‚Ä¶ To him, it felt like the right thing to do, to stop anything before it started. Sometimes he lost his resolve, and opened up to her. And then he would remember his fears and reel it all back in, leaving her in a state of constant uncertainty.  He wanted to love her. He wanted to protect her. He didn‚Äôt know how to do both, so he always landed on rejecting her. Even though it meant never having her. Pushing her away. Losing her. He loved her more than anything, and always vowed to do whatever he could to protect her. No matter the cost to him.

He loved her more than anything, and always vowed to do whatever he could to protect her. No matter the cost to him.

Writing Prompt #2242

Something was wrong today. I could trailing behind me like a shadow, just out of sight, but ever present.
response: Something was wrong today. I could feel it trailing behind me like a shadow, just out of sight, but ever present. There are two of him. He and I both know it. One of him is madly in like with me. And one of him, earnestly pushes me away. I always know which one I‚Äôm dealing with. I‚Äôm always a bit sad when I have to earn back the one who wants me. Even still, there is this part of me who craves the game. I hate feeling things go cold, but I love the challenge of reigniting the fire. Why are we like this? Why do we do this? Because. Because we are intelligent and we get bored. Because we are insecure and we like the reassurance. Because we are a little bit sick, and we crave the remedy. Because we enjoy the chase of each other, I suspect. It‚Äôs the part neither of us wants to ever go completely  cold. We daydream of what everyday could feel like, all while taking turns telling the other why none of this could possibly work. The push and the pull is intoxicating. The surge of emotion and dopamine to two numb and carefully complacent people is like something from a dysfunctional fairy tale. But it‚Äôs our fairy tale. The one I love to read, and then be embarrassed of, and then read again, and then slip hands and fingers into forbidden places I would never admit to him‚Ä¶ I suspect he knows. And even the fact he says that doesn‚Äôt turn him on, makes me want to *do it even more*. Maybe if I do it enough, if I do it right, if the stars align just *so* during a full moon‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶I‚Äôll turn him on. He‚Äôll be unable to resist me. And the chase, our favorite game, will begin all over again. Or maybe, (most likely) this entire game exists in my head alone. Even still, it is the favorite game I get to play. The wondering of it trails behind me, like a shadow; just out of sight, but ever present.

Writing Prompt #2235

“I recommend you start lying, and you get good at it fast.” The old man spoke gruffly, and did not slow his pace for the child.

“But I was taught‚Äî”

“Taught niceties and manners by parents who set you up for a different life than you’re living now. Do you want to be good, or do you want to survive?”

response: Backs pressed to a half-destroyed brick wall, Rogue and Fred sat panting. Their wands were held in white-knuckled grips and they were covered in cuts, bruises, and dirt. "Yeah, I thought we were all gonna die, if I'm entirely honest," Rogue, Fred's savior, responded, looking over the rubble again to see if they were still safe. "I'm sorry- what?!" Fred asked frantically as Rogue grabbed his free hand, tugging him up and running down the- well, what used to be a corridor. "Nothing!" Rogue quickly responded as they ran. Writing Prompt #2225

“Aren’t you simply exhausted with the hero routine?”

“It’s not a routine‚ÄîI have to do what’s right, and I do. No matter how difficult it’s going to be.”

“Yes, it’s so right to sacrifice yourself again and again and again for others who don’t simply care that much that it’s you at the end of the day. As long as someone takes care of their problems, then things are swell.”

writing_prompt:
promptsforthestrugglingauthor:

Writing Prompt #2225

“Aren’t you simply exhausted with the hero routine?”

“It’s not a routine‚ÄîI have to do what’s right, and I do. No matter how difficult it’s going to be.”

“Yes, it’s so right to sacrifice yourself again and again and again for others who don’t simply care that much that it’s you at the end of the day. As long as someone takes care of their problems, then things are swell.”
response: Hero stared at Villain, her bitter banter over. She stared at the Villain her words echoing the Heros own issues from earlier in the day. "And what you propose instead?" "Group therapy, a higher paycheck for both you and the rebuilders, and for gods sake holidays, you dont get holidays or sick leave. Its shit the corporation you work for." Villlain stepped towards Hero careful not to kick off any shingels. "They dont have that much money to spare-" "They reported six hundred million saved by heros alone this year, they keep all that profit, yet you cant by groceries." "The sheer amout of heros is nowhere near the amount of therapists-" "Hence the Group therapy." "A lode of superpowered individuals that could cause mass destruction if set off in one room with no supervisi-" "I never said that." "Its too much-" "Work for the company please! You and I know the sheer amount of death amound first rank heros and the pence their families get for their loss." Hero couldnt think of a reply.  Sirens went off in the distance, vague orders and the smell of soot carried on the wind. "Thats not what i came here to talk about anyway." Villain sighed rubbing her eyes. "I came here to say this is my last fight. Im retiring." The silence was painful, Villain started to turn when Hero walked to edge of her roof and asked. "Youre retiring?" "Yes. You will be assigned to another villain, and i will live out my days in relative calm."  Villain walked forwards jumping onto the roof Hero was on each step forward she took. Hero took one back "Why? What are you planning, what do you to convince me to do?" Heros suspicion outweighed her jealousy. A few steps forward to make sure her voice wasnt taken by the wind, blowing the smoke closer inbetween them. "Well what i plan on doing is none of your business and Im not here to convince you of anything darling. Be safe when im gone." A gust of wind blew through it snatched words out of Villains mouth, laughing as it took them far away from its target. Laughing as she choked on cigarette smoke. Hero blinked tears creaping into view. "Why are you leaving me?" "Im not. Im leaving my life behind not you dear Hero." #hero x villain #hero and villain #writing #writblr #writeblr #my writing #not a prompt

writing_prompt:
Writing Prompt #2225

‚ÄúAren‚Äôt you simply exhausted with the hero routine?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a routine‚ÄîI have to do what‚Äôs right, and I do. No matter how difficult it‚Äôs going to be.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, it‚Äôs so right to sacrifice yourself again and again and again for others who don‚Äôt simply care that much that it‚Äôs you at the end of the day. As long as someone takes care of their problems, then things are swell.‚Äù

Writing Prompt #2223

Being undead for centuries really complicated my sense of what was popular in the modern era. Thankfully, it appeared that my current misunderstanding made me “retro” and “unique” for not quite fitting in.
response: Unless said character has been living in sheer isolation with no form of communication with the world and cultures around them, there is absolutely no excuse for social ignorance. Even if they don't directly interact with people, radio/newspapers/magazines still exist. They would still see people and shop windows at night and maybe creep through morgues and cemeteries etc. No excuse to be behind the times if you are immortal. There are many ways to blend in and hide under the crush of people without just sulking in a castle while stewing in ignorance! #writing prompt #writing #oc prompt #reblogs #pet peeve! #ugg #culturally ignorant vampires are lame #give them a rich life pleaseeee #they have been alive for sooo long #they can hide #they can learn to blend in ffs
